item.title: Why social media agency suck?
item.description: This presentation looks into the demand of the Social Media in rising Social Media Industry. It looks into the pros and cons of social media analyzed by business firms and their misunderstanding with the term SOCIAL MEDIA.

item.title: Responsive web design
item.description: Here’s the slides for a presentation I gave on responsive web design in November 2011. Responsive web design is a very powerful idea: it makes your website look great and usable on desktop computers and all mobile devices. In this presentation I talk about why responsive web design is here to stay. But I also highlight problems that come with it, along with possible solutions.
item.content:encoded: Here’s the slides for a presentation I gave on responsive web design in November 2011. Responsive web design is a very powerful idea: it makes your website look great and usable on desktop computers and all mobile devices. item.title: Getting Shit Done
item.description: Design and development is a lifestyle choice for many of us, but that doesn’t mean we don’t want to get out and enjoy the other things in life. When most of your day is spent on trivial tasks rather than productive work, it’s time to evaluate your process and improve it. This talk will show you how to focus your work day, reduce time spent on the crap you don’t enjoy, and help you Get Shit Done. We’ll talk about the tools and resources you can use to speed up your process, how to find the right routine for you, and when to unplug and get away from your computer.
item.content:encoded: Design and development is a lifestyle choice for many of us, but that doesn’t mean we don’t want to get out and enjoy the other things in life. When most of your day is spent on trivial tasks rather than productive work, it’s time to evaluate your process and improve it. This talk will show you how to focus your work day, reduce time spent on the crap you don’t enjoy, and help you Get Shit Done. We’ll talk about the tools and resources you can use to speed up your process, how to find the right routine for you, and when to unplug and get away from your computer.

item.title: 8 visual steps to customer discovery
item.description: This is a very visual presentation without many words. To get the point, feel free to download the presentation PDF containing speaker notes: http://files.fritsbits.be/8visualsteps_presentation_notes.pdf -------- As a startup, how do you find customers? How do you go from your initial idea that you love so much to a viable product that people want to pay to use? The book ’The entrepreneur’s guide to customer development’ described this process. Being visually oriented I couldn’t make much sense of it, so I decided to draw the book, creating 8 visual steps to customer discovery. Download the visual 8 steps as PDF on http://files.fritsbits.be/8visualstepstocustomerdiscovery.pdf
item.content:encoded: This is a very visual presentation without many words. To get the point, feel free to download the presentation PDF containing speaker notes: http://files.fritsbits.be/8visualsteps_presentation_notes.pdf -------- As a startup, how do you find customers? How do you go from your initial idea that you love so much to a viable product that people want to pay to use? The book ’The entrepreneur’s guide to customer development’ described this process. Being visually oriented I couldn’t make much sense of it, so I decided to draw the book, creating 8 visual steps to customer discovery. Download the visual 8 steps as PDF on http://files.fritsbits.be/8visualstepstocustomerdiscovery.pdf
item.author: fritsbits@slideshare.net(fritsbits)

media:content.media:title: 8 visual steps to customer discovery
media:content.media:description:
This is a very visual presentation without many words. To get the point, feel free to download the presentation PDF containing speaker notes: http://files.fritsbits.be/8visualsteps_presentation_notes.pdf
--------
As a startup, how do you find customers? How do you go from your initial idea that you love so much to a viable product that people want to pay to use?
The book 'The entrepreneur's guide to customer development' described this process. Being visually oriented I couldn't make much sense of it, so I decided to draw the book, creating 8 visual steps to customer discovery.
Download the visual 8 steps as PDF on http://files.fritsbits.be/8visualstepstocustomerdiscovery.pdf
media:content.media:text: This is a very visual presentation without many words. To get the point, feel free to download the presentation PDF containing speaker notes: http://files.fritsbits.be/8visualsteps_presentation_notes.pdf -------- As a startup, how do you find customers? How do you go from your initial idea that you love so much to a viable product that people want to pay to use? The book ’The entrepreneur’s guide to customer development’ described this process. Being visually oriented I couldn’t make much sense of it, so I decided to draw the book, creating 8 visual steps to customer discovery. Download the visual 8 steps as PDF on http://files.fritsbits.be/8visualstepstocustomerdiscovery.pdf

item.slideshare:embed:
8 visual steps to customer discovery

item.title: PSFK Future of Gaming Report [Preview]
item.description: Future Of Gaming report presents key trends emerging within the gaming space that brands, non-profits and communities can leverage to build engagement and motivate their target audience towards achieving a desired goal or outcome. It is designed to inspire anyone tasked with creating compelling user experiences, whether that be on a digital screen, in the real world or somewhere in between.

item.title: Getting to Zero - AIDS Out Life In @abhishek shah
item.description: This World AIDS Day and all year round we’re asking you to Act Aware. Acting aware means finding out the facts about HIV and using this knowledge to protect yourself and others from HIV infection. Many people do not understand how HIV is transmitted, how it can be prevented, or the reality of living with HIV today. People living with HIV can also still face stigma and discrimination from society. Want to do something about this? Share this presentation!
item.content:encoded: This World AIDS Day and all year round we’re asking you to Act Aware. Acting aware means finding out the facts about HIV and using this knowledge to protect yourself and others from HIV infection. Many people do not understand how HIV is transmitted, how it can be prevented, or the reality of living with HIV today. People living with HIV can also still face stigma and discrimination from society. Want to do something about this? Share this presentation!
item.author: abhishekshah@slideshare.net(abhishekshah)

media:content.media:title: Getting to Zero - AIDS Out Life In @abhishek shah
media:content.media:description:
This World AIDS Day – and all year round – we're asking you to Act Aware. Acting aware means finding out the facts about HIV and using this knowledge to protect yourself and others from HIV infection.
Many people do not understand how HIV is transmitted, how it can be prevented, or the reality of living with HIV today. People living with HIV can also still face stigma and discrimination from society.
Want to do something about this? Share this presentation!
media:content.media:text: This World AIDS Day – and all year round – we’re asking you to Act Aware. Acting aware means finding out the facts about HIV and using this knowledge to protect yourself and others from HIV infection. Many people do not understand how HIV is transmitted, how it can be prevented, or the reality of living with HIV today. People living with HIV can also still face stigma and discrimination from society. Want to do something about this? Share this presentation!
